test_system.src.nms_entities.basic_entities package¶

Submodules¶

test_system.src.nms_entities.basic_entities.alert module¶

class test_system.src.nms_entities.basic_entities.alert.Alert(driver: src.drivers.abstract_http_driver.AbstractHttpDriver, nms_id: int, alert_id: int, params: Optional[dict] = None)¶

Bases: src.nms_entities.abstract_basic_object.AbstractBasicObject

NMS Alert class. Can be used to either create a new Alert instance or manage an existing one. If alert_id > src.constants.NEW_OBJECT_ID the values of the parameters are loaded from NMS using the passed nms_id and ‘alert_id`.

>>> alrt = Alert(driver, 0, -1, params={'name': 'TEST_ALRT'})
>>> alrt.save()
Instantiates a new Alert named `TEST_ALRT` for NMS ID 0.
Applies the Alert to NMS.

>>> alrt = Alert(driver, 0, 3)
Load the parameters of Alert ID 3 from NMS. Raises an exception if the given ID is not found.

See the rest methods in the Base class.

Parameters

  • driver (AbstractHttpDriver) – an inherited instance of the driver

  • nms_id (int) – ID of the parent NMS object

  • alert_id (int) – ID of the alert. If ID equals to src.constants.NEW_OBJECT_ID, a new alert is created. Otherwise, the parameters are loaded from NMS.

  • params (dict) – a dictionary that contains the parameters of the alert. Initial dictionary is not changed.

Raises

src.exceptions.ObjectNotFoundException – if alert ID is not found

test_system.src.nms_entities.basic_entities.controller module¶

class test_system.src.nms_entities.basic_entities.controller.Controller(driver: src.drivers.abstract_http_driver.AbstractHttpDriver, network_id: int, controller_id: int, params: Optional[dict] = None)¶

Bases: src.nms_entities.abstract_basic_object.AbstractBasicObject, src.nms_entities.has_up_state_object.HasUpState

NMS Controller class. Can be used to either create a new Controller instance or manage an existing one. If controller_id > src.constants.NEW_OBJECT_ID the values of the parameters are loaded from NMS using the passed network_id and controller_id

>>> ctrl = Controller(driver, 0, -1, params={'name': 'TEST_CTRL', 'mode': 'Hubless_master', 'teleport': 'teleport:0'})
>>> ctrl.save()
Instantiates a new Hubless controller named `TEST_CTRL` and using a Teleport ID 0 in the Network ID 0.
Applies the controller to NMS.

>>> ctrl = Controller(driver, 0, 3)
Loads the parameters of Controller ID 3 from NMS. Raises an exception if the given ID is not found.

See the rest methods in the Base class.

Parameters

  • driver (AbstractHttpDriver) – an inherited instance of the driver

  • network_id (int) – ID of the parent network object

  • controller_id (int) – ID of the controller. If ID equals to src.constants.NEW_OBJECT_ID, a new controller is created. Otherwise, the parameters are loaded from NMS.

  • params (dict) – a dictionary that contains the parameters of the controller. Initial dictionary is not changed.

Raises

src.exceptions.ObjectNotFoundException – if controller ID is not found

get_realtime(command=None)¶

Get Realtime controller data of the passed command from NMS. The commands correspond to the existing show commands in UHP.

>>> ctrl.get_realtime('show system')
Gets the `show system` output
Parameters

command (str) – the command that is executed for getting the Realtime controller data

Returns

  • reply (str) - a string containing the data of the response

  • None - if there is either an error or No reply response from NMS

get_state()¶

Get the current state of the controller NMS object. The state parameters are the following:

‘state’;

‘stn_cn_avg’, ‘hub_cn_avg’, ‘rq_total’, ‘rq_cir’, ‘rq_for_rq’, ‘tx_stn_cn_low’, ‘tx_stn_cn_high’, ‘mf_channels’, ‘hub_own_cn’, ‘hub_tx_level’, ‘hub_rf_lvl’, ‘rx_hub_cn_low’, ‘rx_stn_cn_high’;

‘forward_rate_all’, ‘forward_rate1’, ‘forward_rate2’, ‘forward_rate3’, ‘forward_rate4’, ‘forward_rate5’; ‘forward_rate6’, ‘forward_rate7’,

‘return_rate_all’, ‘return_rate1’, ‘return_rate2’, ‘return_rate3’, ‘return_rate4’, ‘return_rate5’, ‘return_rate6’, and ‘return_rate7’.

Returns dict

a dictionary containing the key-value pairs of the controller state.

classmethod search_by_name(driver: src.drivers.abstract_http_driver.AbstractHttpDriver, network_id: int, name: str)¶

Get a controller NMS object by its name.

>>> ctrl = Controller.search_by_name(driver, 0, 'TEST_CTRL')
Returns an instance of the controller named `TEST_CTRL` in the Network ID 0.
The parameters are loaded from NMS.
Parameters

  • driver (AbstractHttpDriver) – an instance of src.drivers.abstract_http_driver.AbstractHttpDriver class

  • network_id (int) – ID of the parent network object

  • name (str) – the name of a controller to search

Returns

  • an instance of the found controller NMS object.

  • None - if the controller cannot be found

test_system.src.nms_entities.basic_entities.controller_route module¶

class test_system.src.nms_entities.basic_entities.controller_route.ControllerRoute(driver: src.drivers.abstract_http_driver.AbstractHttpDriver, controller_id: int, route_id: int, params: Optional[dict] = None)¶

Bases: src.nms_entities.abstract_basic_object.AbstractBasicObject

NMS Controller routing class. Can be used to either create a new Controller route instance or manage an existing one. If route_id > src.constants.NEW_OBJECT_ID the values of the parameters are loaded from NMS using the passed controller_id and route_id

>>> rt = ControllerRoute(driver, 0, -1, params={'type': 'Static_route', 'service': 'service:0'})
>>> rt.save()
Instantiates a new Controller route of type `Static_route` and service ID 0 for the Controller ID 0.
The rest parameters are default. Applies the route to NMS.

>>> rt = ControllerRoute(driver, 0, 3)
Loads the parameters of Controller route ID 3 from NMS. Raises an exception if the given ID is not found.

See the rest methods in the Base class.

Parameters

  • driver (AbstractHttpDriver) – an inherited instance of the driver

  • controller_id (int) – ID of the parent controller object

  • route_id (int) – ID of the route. If ID equals to src.constants.NEW_OBJECT_ID, a new controller route is created. Otherwise, the parameters are loaded from NMS.

  • params (dict) – a dictionary that contains the parameters of the controller route. Initial dictionary is not changed.

Raises

src.exceptions.ObjectNotFoundException – if controller route ID is not found

test_system.src.nms_entities.basic_entities.network module¶

class test_system.src.nms_entities.basic_entities.network.Network(driver: src.drivers.abstract_http_driver.AbstractHttpDriver, nms_id: int, network_id: int, params: Optional[dict] = None)¶

Bases: src.nms_entities.abstract_basic_object.AbstractBasicObject

NMS Network class. Can be used to either create a new Network instance or manage an existing one. If network_id > src.constants.NEW_OBJECT_ID the values of the parameters are loaded from NMS using the passed nms_id and network_id.

>>> net = Network(driver, 0, -1, params={'name': 'TEST_NET'})
>>> net.save()
Instantiates a new Network named `TEST_NET` and using for NMS ID 0.
Applies the network to NMS.

>>> net = Network(driver, 0, 3)
Load the parameters of Network ID 3 from NMS. Raises an exception if the given ID is not found.

See the rest methods in the Base class.

Parameters

  • driver (AbstractHttpDriver) – an inherited instance of the driver

  • nms_id (int) – ID of the parent NMS object

  • network_id (int) – ID of the network. If ID equals to src.constants.NEW_OBJECT_ID, a new network is created. Otherwise, the parameters are loaded from NMS.

  • params (dict) – a dictionary that contains the parameters of the network. Initial dictionary is not changed.

Raises

src.exceptions.ObjectNotFoundException – if network ID is not found

test_system.src.nms_entities.basic_entities.nms module¶

class test_system.src.nms_entities.basic_entities.nms.Nms(driver: src.drivers.abstract_http_driver.AbstractHttpDriver, parent_id: int, nms_id: int, params: Optional[dict] = None)¶

Bases: src.nms_entities.abstract_basic_object.AbstractBasicObject

NMS global config class. Can be used to manage the settings of NMS. Note: NMS cannot be neither created nor deleted.

>>> nms = Nms(driver, 0, 0)
Loads the parameters of NMS ID 0 from NMS. Raises an exception if the given ID is not found.

See the rest methods in the Base class.

Parameters

  • driver (AbstractHttpDriver) – an inherited instance of the driver

  • parent_id (int) – the parameter value is irrelevant. Used for compability with the parent interface.

  • nms_id (int) – ID of the NMS.

  • params (dict) – a dictionary that contains the parameters of the controller. Initial dictionary is not changed.

Raises

  • src.exceptions.ObjectNotFoundException – if NMS ID is not found

  • src.exceptions.InvalidIdException – if nms_id < 0

test_system.src.nms_entities.basic_entities.station module¶

class test_system.src.nms_entities.basic_entities.station.Station(driver: src.drivers.abstract_http_driver.AbstractHttpDriver, vno_id: int, station_id: int, params: Optional[dict] = None)¶

Bases: src.nms_entities.abstract_basic_object.AbstractBasicObject, src.nms_entities.has_up_state_object.HasUpState

NMS Station class. Can be used to either create a new Station instance or manage an existing one. If station_id > src.constants.NEW_OBJECT_ID the values of the parameters are loaded from NMS using the passed vno_id and station_id.

>>> stn = Station(driver, 0, -1, params={'name': 'TEST_STN', 'serial': '12345'})
>>> stn.save()
Instantiates a new Station named `TEST_STN` with the serial number `12345` in VNO ID 0.
Applies the station to NMS.

>>> stn = Station(driver, 0, 3)
Load the parameters of Station ID 3 from NMS. Raises an exception if the given ID is not found.

See the rest methods in the Base class.

Parameters

  • driver (AbstractHttpDriver) – an inherited instance of the driver

  • vno_id (int) – ID of the parent VNO object

  • station_id (int) – ID of the station. If ID equals to src.constants.NEW_OBJECT_ID, a new station is created. Otherwise, the parameters are loaded from NMS.

  • params (dict) – a dictionary that contains the parameters of the station. Initial dictionary is not changed.

Raises

src.exceptions.ObjectNotFoundException – if station ID is not found

get_realtime(command=None)¶

Get Realtime station data of the passed command from NMS. The commands correspond to the existing show commands in UHP.

>>> stn.get_realtime('show system')
Gets the `show system` output
Parameters

command (str) – the command that is executed for getting the Realtime station data

Returns

  • reply (str) - a string containing the data of the response

  • None - if there is either an error or No reply response from NMS

get_state()¶

Get the current state of the station NMS object. The state parameters are the following:

‘state’;

‘station_cn’, ‘cn_on_hub’, ‘station_tx’, ‘tx_margin’, ‘station_2_cn’, ‘bw_rq’, ‘rx_errors’;

‘forward_rate_all’, ‘forward_rate1’, ‘forward_rate2’, ‘forward_rate3’, ‘forward_rate4’, ‘forward_rate5’, ‘forward_rate6’, ‘forward_rate7’;

‘return_rate_all’, ‘return_rate1’, ‘return_rate2’, ‘return_rate3’, ‘return_rate4’, ‘return_rate5’, ‘return_rate6’, and ‘return_rate7’.

Returns dict

a dictionary containing the key-value pairs of the station state.

test_system.src.nms_entities.basic_entities.station_route module¶

class test_system.src.nms_entities.basic_entities.station_route.StationRoute(driver: src.drivers.abstract_http_driver.AbstractHttpDriver, station_id: int, route_id: int, params: Optional[dict] = None)¶

Bases: src.nms_entities.abstract_basic_object.AbstractBasicObject

>>> rt = StationRoute(driver, 0, -1, params={'type': 'Static_route', 'service': 'service:0'})
>>> rt.save()
Instantiates a new Station route of type `Static_route` and service ID 0 for the Station ID 0.
The rest parameters are default. Applies the route to NMS.

>>> rt = StationRoute(driver, 0, 3)
Loads the parameters of Station route ID 3 from NMS. Raises an exception if the given ID is not found.

See the rest methods in the Base class.

Parameters

  • driver (AbstractHttpDriver) – an inherited instance of the driver

  • station_id (int) – ID of the parent station object

  • route_id (int) – ID of the route. If ID equals to src.constants.NEW_OBJECT_ID, a new station route is created. Otherwise, the parameters are loaded from NMS.

  • params (dict) – a dictionary that contains the parameters of the station route. Initial dictionary is not changed.

Raises

src.exceptions.ObjectNotFoundException – if station route ID is not found
